resources.string: Spanning the river Thames, this shopping mall contains a large number of stores, restaurants and even a movie theater.
This quarter mile long, pedestrianized road is home to a wide range of stores and coffee shops.
Situated at the very end of Broad Street, this shopping center has a range of clothing and toy stores, as well as a small food court.
The ruins of this 12th century abbey are in a large area to the west of Reading\'s town center
Spanning a large area next to Reading Abbey, this park is a beautiful place to visit in warm weather and is home to the Maiwand Lion, a memorial to soldiers from the Afghan wars.
This museum, adjoining the town hall, is home to many exhibits, including roman artifacts from excavations in a nearby village and a replica of the Bayeux Tapestry.
This area of the oracle, covering a large area on both sides of the River Kennet, has every kind of food you could want. From burgers to tapas.
This shopping high street also has a large number of coffee shops and cafes, both on the street itself and along the sprawling alleys and side streets.
The eastern mile of this road is home to every kind of takeaway imaginable. Don\'t feel like going to a restaurant? Come to Oxford road and have a kebab!
An annual rock music festival that takes place over the August bank holiday weekend. Campsites are available at the site and weekend tickets include camping.
A yearly LGBTA pride festival that takes place in August the weekend after Reading Festival. The festival aims to promote diversity and equality, while raising money for charity.
Organised by \'The campaign for real ale\', this festival takes place every year in early May and offers a wide variety of beers, ciders, and cask ales.
